articles.author: David Harding
articles.title: No state funeral for Gorbachev, says Russian media
articles.description: ‘There are no plans to organise a state funeral for Gorbachev,’ reports Interfax news agency
articles.content:
There will be no state funeral for the former president of the Soviet Union, Mikhail Gorbachev, a Russian news agency reported on Wednesday.
There are no plans to organise a state funeral for Gorbac… [+2901 chars]

articles.author: Evgeny Lebedev
articles.title: My dear friend Mikhail Gorbachev, the man who changed the world
articles.description: He ended the Cold War and the nuclear arms race. Here, Evgeny Lebedev remembers a political titan, a loving husband and a big-hearted man
articles.content: The last time I saw Mikhail it was clear his health was declining and the end drawing near. His hair was now totally white and that famous birthmark had retreated to a mere smudge in a face blotched … [+4306 chars]

articles.author: Malcolm Rifkind
articles.title: Mikhail Gorbachev was a hero of our time
articles.description: Former foreign secretary Malcolm Rifkind pays tribute to a great statesman
articles.content: Mikhail Gorbachev was a hero of our time. There is no exaggeration in this assessment. Through his leadership the Cold War came to an end, the Berlin Wall was demolished, the Warsaw Pact was dissolve… [+6654 chars]

articles.author: Dr Julia Patterson
articles.title: What the NHS really needs is to see the end of privatisation by stealth
articles.description: Heal the NHS: Our patients don’t deserve another leader pushing a privatisation agenda, or an apologist for existing privatisation and outsourcing, writes Dr Julia Patterson
articles.content: Im a doctor who gave up working clinically to advocate for NHS staff and patients, and Im incredibly concerned about NHS privatisation. Governments have allowed forms of privatisation to infiltrate t… [+5221 chars]

articles.author: Peter Popham
articles.title: Gorbachev and Raisa: A love story
articles.description: The world remembers the former Soviet leader as a remarkable individual. He was also part of a remarkable marriage. Peter Popham reflects on the special relationship from which all else flowed
articles.content: The moment the Wests image of the Soviet Union began to change can be pinpointed with some exactitude: it was December 1984, when Mikhail Gorbachev, then second-in-command at the Kremlin, arrived in … [+6953 chars]

articles.author: Ian Lloyd
articles.title: The many faces of Diana, Princess of Wales
articles.description: Diana personified life, with all its richness, variety and flaws. It was inconceivable that the woman we had seen progress from vulnerable ingenue to global superstar was no longer part of our lives, writes Ian Lloyd
articles.content: Its often said there was only one Diana. Arguably, there were more than half a dozen versions of the woman who blazed through our lives like a comet from the first sighting of her in the summer of 19… [+613 chars]

articles.author: Harriet Williamson
articles.title: At The Lord of the Rings premiere, ticket winners like me were the lowliest of hobbits
articles.description: In this life, there are the blessed few on the red carpet – and then there are the rest of us, the fan pen scum
articles.content: Last night, I attended my first ever red carpet premiere, for Amazon Primes much-anticipated and famously expensive The Lord of the Rings prequel, The Rings of Power. I didnt go to Leicester Square a… [+5721 chars]

articles.author: Kevin E G Perry
articles.title: Pizza Hut, luxury luggage and Spitting Image: How Mikhail Gorbachev became an unlikely cultural icon
articles.description: The last leader of the Soviet Union, who has died at 91, enjoyed an unusual second act as a spokesperson for Western brands. Kevin E G Perry looks back at how Mikhail Gorbachev came to embody the triumph of capitalism
